org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.parsing.as

Class BaseRepairingTokenBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.parsing.as.BaseRepairingTokenBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRepairingTokenBuffer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RepairingTokenBuffer, StreamingTokenBuffer

    public abstract class BaseRepairingTokenBuffer
extends Object
implements IRepairingTokenBuffer
    Base class for repairing token buffers. This handles insertion of semicolons, and also tracks errors.

        Parameters:
        enable - true if we should insert semicolons into the token stream

      • onSemicolonInserted

        protected final void onSemicolonInserted()
        This method is called when an optional semicolon is inserted and is going to be returned as the next token. It is triggered in IRepairingTokenBuffer.insertSemicolon(boolean).

      • addError

        public void addError(SyntaxProblem error)
        Description copied from interface: IRepairingTokenBuffer
        Adds a syntax error that we encountered during parsing
        Specified by:
        addError in interface IRepairingTokenBuffer
        Parameters:

      • mark

        public final int mark()
        Description copied from interface: IRepairingTokenBuffer
        Marks the position in the underlying token buffer. Token index starts from 0. If we haven't consumed any token from the buffer, the "mark" will be "0". If the first token in the buffer was just consumed, the "mark" will be "1".
        Specified by:
        mark in interface IRepairingTokenBuffer
        Returns:
        Index of the LT(1) token in the buffer.

      • LT

        public ASToken LT(int i)
        Description copied from interface: IRepairingTokenBuffer
        Looks ahead an arbitrary distance and returns back the token. If no token exists, it will return EOF
        Specified by:
        LT in interface IRepairingTokenBuffer
        Parameters:
        i - the offset to look ahead
        Returns:
        the token, or EOF

      • lookAheadSkipInsertedSemicolon

        public ASToken lookAheadSkipInsertedSemicolon()
        Description copied from interface: IRepairingTokenBuffer
        Get the first non-fix-up-semicolon from the look-ahead. For example, if the buffer.isNextSemicolon=true and the look-ahead buffer is [A, B, C, ...], LA(1) will return the fix-up semicolon, but this method will return "A". This is useful for error reporting, because we don't want to treat invalid fix-up semicolons as source code errors.
        Specified by:
        lookAheadSkipInsertedSemicolon in interface IRepairingTokenBuffer
        Returns:
        The first non-fix-up-semicolon from the look-ahead.

      • LA

        public final int LA(int i)
        Description copied from interface: IRepairingTokenBuffer
        Looks ahead an arbitrary distance and returns back the token type. If no token exists, it will return EOF
        Specified by:
        LA in interface IRepairingTokenBuffer
        Parameters:
        i - the offset to look ahead
        Returns:
        the token type, or EOF
